intro: Saurauia meridensis, commonly known as the Canary Islands laurel, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the Canary Islands and is characterized by its evergreen, dense foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, providing a striking visual contrast to its white or pale pink blossoms. Saurauia meridensis is adapted to the humid, subtropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
